hints: The most iconic map in League of Legends.
Has three main lanes and a jungle.
Home to Baron and dragons.
A powerful epic monster in the top river.
Grants a team wide buff upon defeat.
His buff empowers minions and recall.
A core mechanic for earning gold in a lane.
The act of delivering the final blow to a minion.
This is a key farming technique.
A player who does not stay in a lane.
Secures objectives and helps lanes with ganks.
This player clears jungle camps.
Stands for 'Attack Damage Carry'.
A role that specializes in ranged damage.
Often found in the bottom lane.
A role that protects and assists teammates.
Provides vision and crowd control.
Often pairs with the ADC.
The shortest lane on the map.
Typically occupied by mages or assassins.
Connects to all other lanes.
The long lane on one side of the map.
Often played by tanks or fighters.
Isolated from the rest of the action for a while.
A consumable item for providing vision.
Crucial for controlling the map.
Can be placed in bushes or key locations.
A surprise attack on an enemy.
Often initiated by the jungler.
A strategy to gain a numerical advantage in a lane.
The main defensive structures in a lane.
Deals high damage to enemy units.
Must be destroyed to push forward.
A building that spawns super minions when destroyed.
Located at the end of each lane.
Regenerates after a few minutes.
The main objective of the game.
Destroying this wins the game.
Protected by two turrets and an inhibitor.
AI controlled units that march down the lanes.
Also known as creeps.
Provide gold and experience when killed.
A stat that tracks player performance.
Stands for 'Kills, Deaths, and Assists'.
Used to measure contribution in a game.
Leaving your lane to help other lanes.
Common strategy for a mid laner.
A way to apply pressure across the map.
A large scale battle between two teams.

A champion's most powerful ability.

A summoner spell for instant travel.

Used to escape or engage.

Applies a healing reduction effect.
Used to secure kills.

A powerful dragon that spawns late in the game.

The 'Soul Dragon' upgrade.
A neutral monster that helps push a lane.
Replaced the Baron in some patches.
Drops an 'eye' that can be used to summon it.
A jungle buff that grants mana regeneration.
Typically given to the mid laner.
Found in the top jungle.
A jungle buff that grants health regen and a slow.
Gives auto attacks a burning effect.

Used for communication.

A sneaky strategy.
